title: How are the 7 wonders of the ancient world still preserved? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, not all of them have been, but part of why they are so wondrous is that many have survived for so long. It tends to vary which seven wonders are in the list, but of the seven of the Ancient History Encyclopedia, (the Great Pyramid, the Hanging Gardens of Babylon, the Statue of Zeus, the Temple of Artemis, the Mausoleum at Halicarnassus, the Colossus of Rhodes and the Lighthouse at Alexandria) Only the Great Pyramid is completely intact, and the Temple of Artemis has a single pillar standing of what was previously more than 100. The Great Pyramid is still preserved because its almost impossible to destroy, and the others have been destroyed by arsonists, conquerors or natural disasters.

One the Great Pyramids survive, but their gleaming outer later of linestone was stripped long ago. They survived basically because they are small mountains if sandstone. The six others fell in antiquity: The Mausoleum of Holicarnassus Colossus of Rhodes Statue of Jupiter Temple of Athena Hanging Gardens of Babylon Pharos of Alexandra The most common culprit was an earthquake.
